author: Special Correspondent
text: As many as 191 victims, who had lost their dwellings in the Uthapuram clash, received a sum of Rs. 1.14 crore as compensation here on Wednesday. Following the High Court directive, the State government had taken steps to issue the financial relief to the victims. Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao gave away the cheques on the District Courts Complex in the presence of judicial officers, advocates representing the Uthapuram victims, U. Nirmala Rani and R. Rajkumar, Communist functionaries including AIDWA State general secretary S.K. Ponnuthai, TN Untouchability Eradication Movement president Sampath among others who had played a key role in bringing the issue to light. Some of the victims who spoke to reporters thanked the judiciary for its sustained monitoring of the case and for awarding the compensation.
title: Uthapuram clash victims given compensation
